TopicTitle: KSP'ers new and old, come say hello :D

Articles.Content:
Hello

Purchased the game from steam and been playing for a few weeks now.

Kind of addictive and lots of fun. Even if everything goes badly wrong, it's still hilarious.

-J-

Hi all!

I've been playing for a few months now, this really is my kind of game. Thought it would be nice to make an introduction to the forums with the .22 release. Science rocks!

Hello world!

I found out about KSP in .16 days by that i mean i was a KSP video Lurker and a forum lurker and then i just left and forgot about it then after like 5 months after browsing space videos i have come across KSP and i got the game! .19

Thats how i found out about ksp
Elloooooooooo, happy .22 day! lol
Hi, new kerbal-wrangler here. I am trying to find out if Mechjeb works for version 22.0 yet? I purchased the game on Steam. Looking forwards to share with you on the forum.

Hey! Got into KSP a few months back, recently decided to start adding some mods (I like sticking to stock for the challenge / fluid flow of missions)

I've been running a single save-file mission, in which I first sent (identical) rovers to the minnimus and ike and brought them back to kerbin (proudly parked in front of the space center), then got into kethane. Just landed an SSTO kethane tanker with 4500 units on the runway, from orbit. - a modification of my "K-18 Super Kornet". I like treating vehicles and such as somewhat valuable, and don't just churn out new ones, but pretend to have a stock airframe I modify for the mission, etc. I also like to do it entirely by hand, as in, no mechjeb, no calculating delta-v's even, I just tend to err on the side of overbuild and then prolong missions with the extra fuel.

Anyway, wanted to join the forums to swap creations and ideas.

Hi,

First post, been playing the demo, and finally bought it last weekend... Don't get enough time to play this awesome game, I could lose weeks given the chance. Really wanted to mention that over my lunchtime today I finally made an orbital intercept and docked!! I am so proud of myself especially since none of my students have managed this yet!

Looking forward enjoying everyone's posts

Cheers!

Hey fellow kerbonauts!

I discovered this game about a week ago. It sucked me in, and I decided to buy it. I love sandbox games, where you can do what you want, so I tought this game is definitely for me!

Hope you will not explode as many times as I did

Cheers!

Hey fellow kerbonauts!

I discovered this game about a week ago. It sucked me in, and I decided to buy it. I love sandbox games, where you can do what you want, so I tought this game is definitely for me!

Hope you will not explode as many times as I did

Cheers!

We have and will explode as many times as you have

Hi everyone! I'm fairly new to KSP, just started playing in 0.22 when it came out. I didn't want to get started knowing that I'd want to start fresh after 0.22. I've already learned how to dock and rendezvous but I prefer to do Career Mode and have yet to unlock the parts needed. I want to learn how to fly to Duna and maybe build a base there eventually.

Though I should say hello as well. I started playing back with the 0.13 demo and quickly bought the game which was at 0.14 I think. At least I did a lot of Munar landing on winglets that time (before struts). Haven't really played yet since then until career mode came out last week and it engulfed my whole week-end! So I though I might as well join the community
*Even more than you have.A lot more.Like,a lot.A great amount.Like,you know.Universe-size a lot.
So glad to be here
Helo everyone, happy to be on the forums!
Hey kerbonauts, just getting acquainted with the community, been playing on my own for a while, got a lil bored until the career mode released, and now I've been re-addicted

Hey kerbonauts, just getting acquainted with the community, been playing on my own for a while, got a lil bored until the career mode released, and now I've been re-addicted

same boat as you. Trying to find the 'edit signature' button

greetings,

playing since v0.8.5

finally here,

same boat as you. Trying to find the 'edit signature' button

You will have to submit 5 posts. Then you will be recognized as non-bot and may edit your profile.

-Kia
Hello im here
just dropping in to say thanks
Hi, I played the demo in 0.21, decided it was worth it to buy in 0.22
Ah, looks like I'm not the only one who lost my account! I was wondering about that...
Hellllo all. That is all.
Hello everyone. I've been guest lurking these forums for a while but glad to be here registered finally xD

Why hello members of KSP! I am one of the newest of the newbies. I just got the game, after having the demo for about a month or two, and I've gone into Kerbin orbit with a capsule and a space shuttle, and that's pretty much it.
